body.name: Alice's Adventures in Wonderland (Dover Thrift Editions: Classic Novels)
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery February 29 - March 6 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
body.description: One of the English language's most popular and frequently quoted books Intended for young readers but enjoyed equally by adults, the fantastic tale transformed children's literature, liberating it from didactic constraints. Beloved classic describes a little girl's adventures in a topsy-turvy land underground and her encounters with such improbable characters as the White Rabbit, March Hare and Mad Hatter, the sleepy Dormouse, grinning Cheshire Cat, Mock Turtle, and the dreadful Queen of Hearts. Includes all 42 of Sir John Tenniel's original illustrations.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Alice's Adventures in Wonderland and its sequel, Through the Looking Glass, are rich repositories of his sparkling gifts for wordplay, logic, and fantasy. “If you drink much from a bottle marked 'poison' it is certain to disagree with you sooner or later.” “How puzzling all these changes are! I'm never sure what I'm going to be, from one minute to another.” “A dream is not reality but who's to say which is which?” “Begin at the beginning,' the King said gravely, and go on till you come to the end: then stop.” Alice thought to herself "I don't see how he can ever finish, if he doesn't begin.” One of the English language's most popular and frequently quoted books Intended for young readers but enjoyed equally by adults, the fantastic tale transformed children's literature, liberating it from didactic constraints. Beloved classic describes a little girl's adventures in a topsy-turvy land underground and her encounters with such improbable characters as the White Rabbit, March Hare and Mad Hatter, the sleepy Dormouse, grinning Cheshire Cat, Mock Turtle, and the dreadful Queen of Hearts. Includes all 42 of Sir John Tenniel's original illustrations.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2015
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This is the perfect E-book for those of us who are looking for ...
reviews.reviewText: This is the perfect E-book for those of us who are looking for 'Original Versions' of our favorite fairy tales. Most important if you like illustrated fairy tales, because, remember, Lewiss Carroll was one of the first writers who thought about add some pictures in tales and books.Este es el E-Book perfecto para quienes están interesados en las 'Versiones Originales' de sus cuentos clásicos, infantiles o de hadas favoritos. Más aún si prefieren los cuentos ilustrados. Sobre todo teniendo en cuenta que Lewis Carroll fue uno de los primeros escritores en pensar en literatura infantil como tal y en añadir ilustraciones en los cuentos y libros.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 6, 2013
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Get this one
reviews.reviewText: There are a lot of Alice in Wonderland Kindle editions. I personally feel I have made the right choice by getting this one. It has got original nice illustrations by John Tenniel which is aesthetically significant. The price is great. This Kindle edition has got good line spacings and is excellent to read on my Kindle keyboard. Don't spend your money on other kindle editions of Alice as they have either queer or no illustrations. The only disadvantage is being difficult to navigate through chapters. It doesn't worry me though. The other good news is you will get the entire series in one download. A nice read in a rainy afternoon.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2013
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars The Best Kindle Option Available
reviews.reviewText: I took a gamble on buying this edition when no one had reviewed it yet. I tried several other Kindle editions available and had found them truly appalling in terms of formatting. This however, is significantly better, featuring well structured chapter breaks and all the original illustrations, which enhance the story a lot.Furthermore, considering it contains both books, plus the excellent Hunting of the Snark, it is a fantastic price.However, there are still some glaring mistakes, such as some formatting bugs in a few of the poems and spelling errors in places (such as at the start of Looking Glass, where some of the Ls are replaced with 1s - I guess a scanner did the 'writing here').5 stars for the great price and superior formatting over the other options. -1 star for the glaring lack of proof reading from the publisher.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2014
reviews.reviewText: I am one to look for a greater meaning. However, I'm not sure I can find one or that the author even had one! I've read that Carroll said that it was written to be purely nonsense for nonsense sake (my words not a quote!) and I think I'm ok with that! I loved Disney's version as a child and many other adaptations over the years. I can't believe it took me so long to actual read this! I do hope Alice never lost her imagination as we adults tend to do. Reading Alice's adventures helps us recall a bit of that fantastical, nonsensical world of childhood.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 19, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The granddaddy of children's stories.
reviews.reviewText: I grew watching the Disney cartoon of Alice in Wonderland and it's great to read the original book and get absorbed into the story.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Tiny writing, hard to read
reviews.reviewText: I was disappointed by the font size.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2014
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It's great to have the original complete collection
reviews.reviewText: It's great to have the original complete collection. You have so many versions of the story that coming to the source is illuminating. About the illustration, you can understand a little more of the sense of absurd that Lewis Carroll wanted to show, not the sweetened versions that came after. It’s a book that you could return to a thousand times and find something that catches you again. Mapplewood work of collecting all the media versions is great for fans that want to track everything that is available. Absolutely wonderful to have it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 16, 2014
reviews.reviewText: We all know the plot. This is a review of the Dover Thrift Editions copy.Since this wonderful text and Sir John Tenniel's original illustrations is in the public domain, the book will remain easy to get, cheap. This particular edition does NOT also contain Through the Looking Glass, which often is published right in the same volume as this one. Dover edition has cruddy pulp pages, but it's unabridged and no one should complain if they can get a readable copy for 1 cent.
Amei ler esse livro, estou começando no inglês então me ajudou muito

reviews.reviewTitle: 高2ならだいたい読めます
reviews.reviewText: 分からない単語は調べて読んでますが大体は読めます

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on June 12, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: An absolute classic of a book.
reviews.reviewText: Delighted to purchase this. This is the first time I have seen all four areas of LC in one book. "Alice's Adventures Underground" and "Wonderland are very similar. but I did enjoy reading "The Hunting of the Snark" and "Through the Looking Glass". It helps a lot when reading the Looking Glass if one understands the rules of Chess, and also plays the game, both of which I do! If one doesn't understand chess at all, some of the literature in "The Looking Glass" is likely to be confusing. I would strongly recommend studying the rules of Chess before reading.That aside, it is a classic piece of literature. I have heard it said that "Wonderland" is one of LC's visions when he had a Grand Mal (apparently he was epileptic) but having got this condition myself (extremely well-controlled I might add). I am not sure if this is true. Nevertheless, this is a welcome addition to my ever growing collection! Well worth reading!

Ho letto per la prima volta "Alice nel Paese delle Meraviglie" in italiano, e ne sono rimasta molto delusa. Questo libro straordinario non può essere scisso dalla lingua in cui è stato scritto, e infatti ho amato la versione originale! Uno scoppio di immaginazione assolutamente geniale e irripetibile, un uso del linguaggio meraviglioso. Che altro dire! Non penso che possa definirsi un libro per bambini.
Una edicion muy bonita con imagenes de los escritos a mano de este gran libro.Una calidad precio fantastica sin duda
